Description:
Free text field to provide additional required information for the consignee to prepare for the shipment arrival,
e.g. additional required documents to prepare and present for shipment release - country specific.
Visualization of an arrival notice, as an embedded document
Base64 representation of the binary document content
Content type of document
Document name

Refers to the shipment term at the **unloading** of the cargo out of the container. Possible values are:

- `FCL` (Full Container Load)
- `LCL` (Less than Container Load)
Additional clauses for a specific shipment added by the carrier to the Bill of Lading, subject to local rules / guidelines or certain mandatory information required to be shared with the customer.

The `SCAC` code (provided by [NMFTA](https://nmfta.org/scac/)) or `SMDG` code (provided by [SMDG](https://smdg.org/documents/smdg-code-lists/smdg-liner-code-list/)) of the issuing carrier of the `Transport Document`. `carrierCodeListProvider` defines which list the `carrierCode` is based upon.

The code list provider for the `carrierCode`. Possible values are:
- `SMDG` (Ship Message Design Group)
- `NMFTA` (National Motor Freight Traffic Association)
The party to contact for any inquiries related to this Arrival Notice.
`E-mail` address to be used
Name of the contact
Phone number for the contact. Phone **MUST** include an international phone number format as defined in the [ITU-T recommendation E.123](https://www.itu.int/rec/T-REC-E.123/en).
The party to contact in relation to the cargo release (e.g. a shipping agency other than the POD carrier agency).
`E-mail` address to be used
Name of the contact
Phone number for the contact. Phone **MUST** include an international phone number format as defined in the [ITU-T recommendation E.123](https://www.itu.int/rec/T-REC-E.123/en).
A list of `Charges`
The code specifying the measure unit used for the corresponding unit price for this cost, such as per day, per ton, per square metre.
Free text field describing the charge to apply
The monetary value of all freight and other service charges for a transport document, with a maximum of 2-digit decimals.
The currency for the charge, using a 3-character code ([ISO 4217](https://www.iso.org/iso-4217-currency-codes.html)).

An indicator of whether a charge is prepaid (PRE) or collect (COL). When prepaid, the charge is the responsibility of the shipper or the Invoice payer on behalf of the shipper (if provided). When collect, the charge is the responsibility of the consignee or the Invoice payer on behalf of the consignee (if provided).

- `PRE` (Prepaid)
- `COL` (Collect)
The amount of unit for this charge item.
The unit price of this charge item in the currency of the charge.
A list of `ConsignmentItems`
A list of `HS Codes` that apply to this `consignmentItem`
A list of all `cargoItems`
Gross volume of the cargo.

The unit of measure which can be expressed in imperial or metric terms:
- `FTQ` (Cubic foot)
- `MTQ` (Cubic meter)
Calculated by multiplying the width, height, and length of the packed cargo. A maximum of 4 decimals should be provided.
Gross weight of the cargo.

The unit of measure which can be expressed in imperial or metric terms:
- `KGM` (Kilograms)
- `LBR` (Pounds)
The weight of the cargo item including packaging being carried in the container. Excludes the tare weight of the container. A maximum of 3 decimals should be provided.
Net volume of the cargo.

The unit of measure which can be expressed in imperial or metric terms:
- `FTQ` (Cubic foot)
- `MTQ` (Cubic meter)
Calculated by multiplying the width, height, and length of the cargo, excluding packaging.
Net weight of the cargo.

The unit of measure which can be expressed in imperial or metric terms:
- `KGM` (Kilograms)
- `LBR` (Pounds)
The weight of the cargo item excluding packaging being carried in the container. Excludes the tare weight of the container. A maximum of 3 decimals should be provided.
A list of `Customs references`
The 2 characters for the country code using [ISO 3166-1 alpha-2](https://www.iso.org/obp/ui/#iso:pub:PUB500001:en)
The reference type code as defined in the relevant customs jurisdiction.

The unique identifier for the equipment, which should follow the BIC ISO Container Identification Number where possible.
According to [ISO 6346](https://www.iso.org/standard/83558.html), a container identification code consists of a 4-letter prefix and a 7-digit number (composed of a 3-letter owner code, a category identifier, a serial number, and a check-digit).

If a container does not comply with [ISO 6346](https://www.iso.org/standard/83558.html), it is suggested to follow [Recommendation #2: Containers with non-ISO identification](https://smdg.org/documents/smdg-recommendations) from SMDG.
Export license applicable to this cargo item.
Expiry date of the `Export License`.

Information provided by the shipper to indicate whether an `Export License` or permit is required for this shipment/commodity/destination.

**Note:** If this property is omitted, it may be interpreted differently by different API providers and by the same API provider in different contexts.
Issue date of the `Export License`.

Reference number assigned to an `Export License` or permit, which authorizes a business or individual to export specific goods to specific countries under defined conditions. It is a permit that is required when shipping certain restricted or controlled goods, such as military equipment, high-tech items, chemicals, or items subject to international regulations. The `Export License` must be valid at time of departure.
Import license applicable to this cargo item.
Expiry date of the `Import License`.

Information provided by the shipper to indicate whether an `Import License` or permit is required for this shipment/commodity/destination.

**Note:** If this property is omitted, it may be interpreted differently by different API providers and by the same API provider in different contexts.
Issue date of the `Import License`.

Reference number assigned to an `Import License` or permit, issued by countries exercising import controls that authorizes the importation of the articles stated in the license. The `Import License` must be valid at time of arrival.
A list of `National Commodity Codes` that apply to this `cargoItem`
The 2 characters for the country code using [ISO 3166-1 alpha-2](https://www.iso.org/obp/ui/#iso:pub:PUB500001:en)

The national commodity classification code, which can be one of the following values defined by DCSA:
- `NCM` (Nomenclatura Comum do Mercosul)
- `HTS` (Harmonized Tariff Schedule)
- `SCHEDULE_B` ( Schedule B)
- `TARIC` (Integrated Tariff of the European Communities)
- `CN` (Combined Nomenclature)
- `CUS` (Customs Union and Statistics)
A list of `national commodity codes` values.
Packaging information for this cargo item.
A list of `Dangerous Goods`

Path: ArrivalNotice / consignmentItems / cargoItems / outerPackaging / dangerousGoods / EMSNumber
Description: The emergency schedule identified in the IMO EmS Guide – Emergency Response Procedures for Ships Carrying Dangerous Goods. Comprises 2 values; 1 for spillage and 1 for fire. Possible values spillage: S-A to S-Z. Possible values fire: F-A to F-Z.

Path: ArrivalNotice / consignmentItems / cargoItems / outerPackaging / dangerousGoods / NANumber
Description: Four-digit number that is assigned to dangerous, hazardous, and harmful substances by the United States Department of Transportation.

Path: ArrivalNotice / consignmentItems / cargoItems / outerPackaging / dangerousGoods / UNNumber
Description: United Nations Dangerous Goods Identifier (UNDG) assigned by the UN Sub-Committee of Experts on the Transport of Dangerous Goods and shown in the IMO IMDG.

Path: ArrivalNotice / consignmentItems / cargoItems / outerPackaging / dangerousGoods / codedVariantList
Description:
Four-character code supplied by Exis Technologies that assists to remove ambiguities when identifying a variant within a single UN number or NA number that may occur when two companies exchange DG information.

Character | Valid Characters | Description
:--------:|------------------|------------
1| 0, 1, 2, 3|The packing group. Code 0 indicates there is no packing group
2|0 to 9 and A to Z|A sequence letter for the PSN, or 0 if there were no alternative PSNs
3 and 4|0 to 9 and A to Z|Two sequence letters for other information, for the cases where the variant is required because of different in subrisks, packing instruction etc.

Path: ArrivalNotice / consignmentItems / cargoItems / outerPackaging / dangerousGoods / competentAuthorityApproval
Description: Name and reference number of the competent authority providing the approval.

Path: ArrivalNotice / consignmentItems / cargoItems / outerPackaging / dangerousGoods / emergencyContactDetails
Description: 24 hr emergency contact details

Path: ArrivalNotice / consignmentItems / cargoItems / outerPackaging / dangerousGoods / emergencyContactDetails / contact
Description: Name of the Contact person during an emergency.

Path: ArrivalNotice / consignmentItems / cargoItems / outerPackaging / dangerousGoods / emergencyContactDetails / phone
Description: Phone number for the contact. Phone **MUST** include an international phone number format as defined in the [ITU-T recommendation E.123](https://www.itu.int/rec/T-REC-E.123/en).

Path: ArrivalNotice / consignmentItems / cargoItems / outerPackaging / dangerousGoods / emergencyContactDetails / provider
Description: Name of the third party vendor providing emergency support

Path: ArrivalNotice / consignmentItems / cargoItems / outerPackaging / dangerousGoods / emergencyContactDetails / referenceNumber
Description: Contract reference for the emergency support provided by an external third party vendor.

Path: ArrivalNotice / consignmentItems / cargoItems / outerPackaging / dangerousGoods / endOfHoldingTime
Description: Date by when the refrigerated liquid needs to be delivered.

Path: ArrivalNotice / consignmentItems / cargoItems / outerPackaging / dangerousGoods / fumigationDateTime
Description: Date & time when the container was fumigated

Path: ArrivalNotice / consignmentItems / cargoItems / outerPackaging / dangerousGoods / grossWeight
Description: Total weight of the goods carried, including packaging.

Path: ArrivalNotice / consignmentItems / cargoItems / outerPackaging / dangerousGoods / grossWeight / unit
Description:
The unit of measure which can be expressed in imperial or metric terms:
- `KGM` (Kilograms)
- `LBR` (Pounds)

Path: ArrivalNotice / consignmentItems / cargoItems / outerPackaging / dangerousGoods / grossWeight / value
Description: The grand total weight of the DG cargo and weight per `UNNumber`/`NANumber` including packaging items being carried, which can be expressed in imperial or metric terms, as provided by the shipper.

Path: ArrivalNotice / consignmentItems / cargoItems / outerPackaging / dangerousGoods / imoClass
Description:
The hazard class code of the referenced dangerous goods according to the specified regulation. Examples of possible values are:

- `1.1A` (Substances and articles which have a mass explosion hazard)
- `1.6N` (Extremely insensitive articles which do not have a mass explosion hazard)
- `2.1` (Flammable gases)
- `8` (Corrosive substances)

Path: ArrivalNotice / consignmentItems / cargoItems / outerPackaging / dangerousGoods / inhalationZone
Description:
The zone classification of the toxicity of the inhalant. Possible values are:

- `A` (Hazard Zone A) can be assigned to specific gases and liquids
- `B` (Hazard Zone B) can be assigned to specific gases and liquids
- `C` (Hazard Zone C) can **only** be assigned to specific gases
- `D` (Hazard Zone D) can **only** be assigned to specific gases

Path: ArrivalNotice / consignmentItems / cargoItems / outerPackaging / dangerousGoods / innerPackagings
Description: A list of `Inner Packings` contained inside this `outer packaging/overpack`.

Path: ArrivalNotice / consignmentItems / cargoItems / outerPackaging / dangerousGoods / innerPackagings / description
Description: Description of the packaging.

Path: ArrivalNotice / consignmentItems / cargoItems / outerPackaging / dangerousGoods / innerPackagings / material
Description: The `material` used for the `Inner Packaging` of the referenced `Dangerous Goods`.

Path: ArrivalNotice / consignmentItems / cargoItems / outerPackaging / dangerousGoods / innerPackagings / quantity
Description: Count of `Inner Packagings` of the referenced `Dangerous Goods`.

Path: ArrivalNotice / consignmentItems / cargoItems / outerPackaging / dangerousGoods / isCompetentAuthorityApprovalRequired
Description: Indicates if the cargo require approval from authorities

Path: ArrivalNotice / consignmentItems / cargoItems / outerPackaging / dangerousGoods / isEmptyUncleanedResidue
Description: Indicates if the cargo is residue.

Path: ArrivalNotice / consignmentItems / cargoItems / outerPackaging / dangerousGoods / isExceptedQuantity
Description: Indicates if the dangerous goods can be transported as excepted quantity in accordance with Chapter 3.5 of the IMO IMDG Code.

Path: ArrivalNotice / consignmentItems / cargoItems / outerPackaging / dangerousGoods / isHot
Description: Indicates if high temperature cargo is shipped.

Path: ArrivalNotice / consignmentItems / cargoItems / outerPackaging / dangerousGoods / isLimitedQuantity
Description: Indicates if the dangerous goods can be transported as limited quantity in accordance with Chapter 3.4 of the IMO IMDG Code.

Path: ArrivalNotice / consignmentItems / cargoItems / outerPackaging / dangerousGoods / isMarinePollutant
Description: Indicates if the goods belong to the classification of Marine Pollutant.

Path: ArrivalNotice / consignmentItems / cargoItems / outerPackaging / dangerousGoods / isReportableQuantity
Description: Indicates if a container of hazardous material is at the reportable quantity level. If `true`, a report to the relevant authority must be made in case of spill.

Path: ArrivalNotice / consignmentItems / cargoItems / outerPackaging / dangerousGoods / isSalvagePackings
Description: Indicates if the cargo has special packaging for the transport, recovery or disposal of damaged, defective, leaking or nonconforming hazardous materials packages, or hazardous materials that have spilled or leaked.

Path: ArrivalNotice / consignmentItems / cargoItems / outerPackaging / dangerousGoods / isWaste
Description: Indicates if waste is being shipped

Path: ArrivalNotice / consignmentItems / cargoItems / outerPackaging / dangerousGoods / limits
Description: Limits for the `Dangerous Goods`. The same `Temperature Unit` must apply to all attributes in this structure.

Path: ArrivalNotice / consignmentItems / cargoItems / outerPackaging / dangerousGoods / limits / SADT
Description: Lowest temperature in which self-accelerating decomposition may occur in a substance

Path: ArrivalNotice / consignmentItems / cargoItems / outerPackaging / dangerousGoods / limits / SAPT
Description: Lowest temperature in which self-accelerating polymerization may occur in a substance

Path: ArrivalNotice / consignmentItems / cargoItems / outerPackaging / dangerousGoods / limits / flashPoint
Description:
Lowest temperature at which a chemical can vaporize to form an ignitable mixture in air.

**Condition:** only applicable to specific hazardous goods according to the IMO IMDG Code.

Path: ArrivalNotice / consignmentItems / cargoItems / outerPackaging / dangerousGoods / limits / temperatureUnit
Description:
The unit for **all attributes in the limits structure** in Celsius or Fahrenheit

- `CEL` (Celsius)
- `FAH` (Fahrenheit)

Path: ArrivalNotice / consignmentItems / cargoItems / outerPackaging / dangerousGoods / limits / transportControlTemperature
Description: Maximum temperature at which certain substance (such as organic peroxides and self-reactive and related substances) can be safely transported for a prolonged period.

Path: ArrivalNotice / consignmentItems / cargoItems / outerPackaging / dangerousGoods / limits / transportEmergencyTemperature
Description: Temperature at which emergency procedures shall be implemented

Path: ArrivalNotice / consignmentItems / cargoItems / outerPackaging / dangerousGoods / netExplosiveContent
Description: The total weight of the explosive substances, without the packaging, casings, etc.

Path: ArrivalNotice / consignmentItems / cargoItems / outerPackaging / dangerousGoods / netExplosiveContent / unit
Description:
The unit of measure which can be expressed in imperial or metric terms:
- `KGM` (Kilograms)
- `LBR` (Pounds)
- `GRM` (Grams)
- `ONZ` (Ounce)

Path: ArrivalNotice / consignmentItems / cargoItems / outerPackaging / dangerousGoods / netExplosiveContent / value
Description: The total weight of the explosive substances, without the packaging’s, casings, etc.

Path: ArrivalNotice / consignmentItems / cargoItems / outerPackaging / dangerousGoods / netVolume
Description: The volume of the referenced dangerous goods. Only applicable to liquids and gas.

Path: ArrivalNotice / consignmentItems / cargoItems / outerPackaging / dangerousGoods / netVolume / unit
Description:
The unit of measure which can be expressed in imperial or metric terms:
- `FTQ` (Cubic foot)
- `MTQ` (Cubic meter)
- `LTR` (Litre)

Path: ArrivalNotice / consignmentItems / cargoItems / outerPackaging / dangerousGoods / netVolume / value
Description: The volume of the referenced dangerous goods.

Path: ArrivalNotice / consignmentItems / cargoItems / outerPackaging / dangerousGoods / netWeight
Description: Total weight of the goods carried, excluding packaging.

Path: ArrivalNotice / consignmentItems / cargoItems / outerPackaging / dangerousGoods / netWeight / unit
Description:
The unit of measure which can be expressed in imperial or metric terms:
- `KGM` (Kilograms)
- `LBR` (Pounds)

Path: ArrivalNotice / consignmentItems / cargoItems / outerPackaging / dangerousGoods / netWeight / value
Description: Total weight of the goods carried, excluding packaging.

Path: ArrivalNotice / consignmentItems / cargoItems / outerPackaging / dangerousGoods / packingGroup
Description: The packing group according to the UN Recommendations on the Transport of Dangerous Goods and IMO IMDG Code.

Path: ArrivalNotice / consignmentItems / cargoItems / outerPackaging / dangerousGoods / properShippingName
Description: The proper shipping name for goods under IMDG Code, or the product name for goods under IBC Code and IGC Code, or the bulk cargo shipping name for goods under IMSBC Code, or the name of oil for goods under Annex I to the MARPOL Convention.

Path: ArrivalNotice / consignmentItems / cargoItems / outerPackaging / dangerousGoods / segregationGroups
Description:
List of the segregation groups applicable to specific hazardous goods according to the IMO IMDG Code.

**Condition:** only applicable to specific hazardous goods.

Path: ArrivalNotice / consignmentItems / cargoItems / outerPackaging / dangerousGoods / subsidiaryRisk1
Description: Any risk in addition to the class of the referenced dangerous goods according to the IMO IMDG Code.

Path: ArrivalNotice / consignmentItems / cargoItems / outerPackaging / dangerousGoods / subsidiaryRisk2
Description: Any risk in addition to the class of the referenced dangerous goods according to the IMO IMDG Code.

Path: ArrivalNotice / consignmentItems / cargoItems / outerPackaging / dangerousGoods / technicalName
Description: The recognized chemical or biological name or other name currently used for the referenced dangerous goods as described in chapter 3.1.2.8 of the IMDG Code.
Description of the outer packaging/overpack.

The code of the packaging as per IMO.

**Condition:** only applicable to dangerous goods if specified in the [IMO IMDG code](https://www.imo.org/en/publications/Pages/IMDG%20Code.aspx). If not available, the `packageCode` as per UN recommendation 21 should be used.
Specifies the number of outer packagings/overpacks associated with this `Cargo Item`.

A code identifying the outer packaging/overpack. `PackageCode` must follow the codes specified in [Recommendation N°21](https://unece.org/trade/uncefact/cl-recommendations)

**Condition:** only applicable to dangerous goods if the `IMO packaging code` is not available.

Property to clearly indicate if the products, packaging and any other items are made of wood. Possible values include:
- `NOT_APPLICABLE` (if no wood or any other wood product such as packaging and supports are being shipped)
- `NOT_TREATED_AND_NOT_CERTIFIED` (if the wood or wooden materials have not been treated nor fumigated and do not include a certificate)
- `PROCESSED` (if the wood or wooden materials are entirely made of processed wood, such as plywood, particle board, sliver plates of wood and wood laminate sheets produced using glue, heat, pressure or a combination of these)
- `TREATED_AND_CERTIFIED` (if the wood or wooden materials have been treated and/or fumigated and include a certificate)
The associated booking number provided by the carrier for this `Consignment Item`.
A list of `Customs references`
The 2 characters for the country code using [ISO 3166-1 alpha-2](https://www.iso.org/obp/ui/#iso:pub:PUB500001:en)
The reference type code as defined in the relevant customs jurisdiction.

A plain language description that is precise enough for Customs services to be able to identify the goods. General terms (i.e. 'consolidated', 'general cargo' 'parts' or 'freight of all kinds') or not sufficiently precise description cannot be accepted.

**Condition:** The order of the items in this array **MUST** be preserved as by the provider of the API.

Issue date of the `Export License`.

Reference number assigned to an `Export License` or permit, which authorizes a business or individual to export specific goods to specific countries under defined conditions. It is a permit that is required when shipping certain restricted or controlled goods, such as military equipment, high-tech items, chemicals, or items subject to international regulations. The `Export License` must be valid at time of departure.
Import license for the consignment item.
Expiry date of the `Import License`.

Information provided by the shipper to indicate whether an `Import License` or permit is required for this shipment/commodity/destination.

**Note:** If this property is omitted, it may be interpreted differently by different API providers and by the same API provider in different contexts.
Issue date of the `Import License`.

A list of `National Commodity Codes` that apply to this `commodity`
The 2 characters for the country code using [ISO 3166-1 alpha-2](https://www.iso.org/obp/ui/#iso:pub:PUB500001:en)

The national commodity classification code, which can be one of the following values defined by DCSA:
- `NCM` (Nomenclatura Comum do Mercosul)

List of `referenceValues` for a given `referenceType`.

A list of the `ShippingMarks` applicable to this `consignmentItem`

Customs import declaration procedure

Indicates the type of service offered at `Destination`. The options are:

- `CY` (Container yard (incl. rail ramp))
- `SD` (Store Door)
- `CFS` (Container Freight Station)
Document parties

The address of the party to be displayed on the `Transport Document`. The displayed address may be used to match the address provided in the `Letter of Credit`.

**Conditions:** If provided:
  - the displayed address must be included in the `Transport Document`.
  - for physical BL (`isElectronic=false`), it is only allowed to provide max 2 lines of 35 characters
  - for electronic BL (`isElectronic=true`), the limit is 6 lines of 35 characters
  - the order of the items in this array **MUST** be preserved as by the provider of the API.
List of codes identifying the party

The name of the code list, code generation mechanism or code authority for the `partyCode`. Example values could be:
- `DID` (Decentralized Identifier) for `codeListProvider` `W3C`
- `LEI` (Legal Entity Identifier) for `codeListProvider` `GLEIF`
- `DUNS` (Data Universal Numbering System) for `codeListProvider` `DNB`

A list of codes identifying a party. Possible values are:
- `WAVE` (Wave)
- `CARX` (CargoX)
- `ESSD` (EssDOCS)
- `IDT` (ICE Digital Trade)
- `BOLE` (Bolero)
- `EDOX` (EdoxOnline)
- `IQAX` (IQAX)
- `SECR` (Secro)
- `TRGO` (TradeGO)
- `ETEU` (eTEU)
- `TRAC` (Enigio trace:original)
- `BRIT` (BRITC eBL)
- `GSBN` (Global Shipping Business Network)
- `WISE` (WiseTech)
- `GLEIF` (Global Legal Entity Identifier Foundation)
- `W3C` (World Wide Web Consortium)
- `DNB` (Dun and Bradstreet)
- `FMC` (Federal Maritime Commission)
- `DCSA` (Digital Container Shipping Association)
- `ZZZ` (Mutually defined)
Code to identify the party as provided by the code list provider
Party location

The UN Location code specifying where the place is located. The pattern used must be

- 2 characters for the country code using [ISO 3166-1 alpha-2](https://www.iso.org/obp/ui/#iso:pub:PUB500001:en)
- 3 characters to code a location within that country. Letters A-Z and numbers from 2-9 can be used

More info can be found here: [UN/LOCODE](https://unece.org/trade/cefact/UNLOCODE-Download)
Location address
A numbered box at a post office where a person or business can have mail or parcels delivered.
The name of the city.
The 2 characters for the country code using [ISO 3166-1 alpha-2](https://www.iso.org/obp/ui/#iso:pub:PUB500001:en)
The floor of the street number.
The post code of the address.
The name of the state/region.
The name of the street.
The number of the street.
Facility location expressed using a facility code. Requires a code and a provider (SMDG or BIC).

The code used for identifying the specific facility. This code does not include the UN Location Code.
The definition of the code depends on the `facilityCodeListProvider`. As code list providers maintain multiple codeLists the following codeList is used:
- `SMDG` (the codeList used is the [SMDG Terminal Code List](https://smdg.org/documents/smdg-code-lists/))
- `BIC` (the codeList used is the [BIC Facility Codes](https://www.bic-code.org/facility-codes/))

The provider used for identifying the facility Code. Some facility codes are only defined in combination with an `UN Location Code`
- `BIC` (Requires a UN Location Code)
- `SMDG` (Requires a UN Location Code)
An object used to express a location using `latitude` and `longitude`.
Geographic coordinate that specifies the north–south position of a point on the Earth's surface.
Geographic coordinate that specifies the east–west position of a point on the Earth's surface.
The name of the location.
Party contact details
`E-mail` address to be used
Name of the contact
Phone number for the contact. Phone **MUST** include an international phone number format as defined in the [ITU-T recommendation E.123](https://www.itu.int/rec/T-REC-E.123/en).

Specifies the role of the party in a given context. Possible values are:

- `OS` (Shipper)
- `CN` (Consignee)
- `ZZZ` (Endorsee)
- `RW` (Issuing Party)
- `CG` (Carrier's Agent at Destination)
- `N1` (First Notify Party)
- `N2` (Second Notify Party)
- `NI` (Other Notify Party)
- `SCO` (Service Contract Owner)
- `DDR` (Consignor's freight forwarder)
- `DDS` (Consignee's freight forwarder)
- `COW` (Invoice payer on behalf of the consignor (shipper))
- `COX` (Invoice payer on behalf of the consignee)
- `CS` (Consolidator)
- `MF` (Manufacturer)
- `WH` (Warehouse Keeper)
Party name
A list of `Purchase Order Reference`s
A reference linked to the `Consignee`.
List of tax or legal references relevant to the party
The 2 characters for the country code using [ISO 3166-1 alpha-2](https://www.iso.org/obp/ui/#iso:pub:PUB500001:en)
The reference type code as defined by the relevant tax and/or legal authority.
The value of the `taxLegalReference`

Can be one of the following values as per the Union Customs Code art. 5(4):
- `NATURAL_PERSON` (A person that is an individual living human being)
- `LEGAL_PERSON` (person (including a human being and public or private organizations) that can perform legal actions, such as own a property, sue and be sued)
- `ASSOCIATION_OF_PERSONS` (Not a legal person, but recognised under Union or National law as having the capacity to perform legal acts)
List of free time conditions applicable to this shipment at destination

Description of the conditions under which this free time item applies.
It can include references to the carrier website or individual charges as per service contract/agreement.
The duration expressed in `timeUnit`s for which this free time item applies.

Unique code identifying the equipment size and type used to transport commodities.
The code can refer to either the ISO size type (e.g. 22G1) or the ISO type group (e.g. 22GP)
following the [ISO 6346](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_6346) standard.

Code identifying the unit in which free time is expressed
- `CD` - Calendar days
- `WD` - Working days
- `HR` - Hours

Code used to denote the type of free time.
- `DEM` - Demurrage
- `DET` - Detention
- `PDM` - Per Diem
- `STO` - Storage
An indicator whether the transport document is electronically transferred.
The date and time when the Arrival Notice was issued.

Free text used to indicate a certain version or type of arrival notice,
for example "Warning", "Updated", "Second", "Third" etc.
Name identifying the entity responsible for freight payment.
Pickup location

The UN Location code specifying where the place is located. The pattern used must be

- 2 characters for the country code using [ISO 3166-1 alpha-2](https://www.iso.org/obp/ui/#iso:pub:PUB500001:en)
- 3 characters to code a location within that country. Letters A-Z and numbers from 2-9 can be used

More info can be found here: [UN/LOCODE](https://unece.org/trade/cefact/UNLOCODE-Download)
Location address
A numbered box at a post office where a person or business can have mail or parcels delivered.
The name of the city.
The 2 characters for the country code using [ISO 3166-1 alpha-2](https://www.iso.org/obp/ui/#iso:pub:PUB500001:en)
The floor of the street number.
The post code of the address.
The name of the state/region.
The name of the street.
The number of the street.
Facility location expressed using a facility code. Requires a code and a provider (SMDG or BIC).

The code used for identifying the specific facility. This code does not include the UN Location Code.
The definition of the code depends on the `facilityCodeListProvider`. As code list providers maintain multiple codeLists the following codeList is used:
- `SMDG` (the codeList used is the [SMDG Terminal Code List](https://smdg.org/documents/smdg-code-lists/))
- `BIC` (the codeList used is the [BIC Facility Codes](https://www.bic-code.org/facility-codes/))

The provider used for identifying the facility Code. Some facility codes are only defined in combination with an `UN Location Code`
- `BIC` (Requires a UN Location Code)
- `SMDG` (Requires a UN Location Code)
An object used to express a location using `latitude` and `longitude`.
Geographic coordinate that specifies the north–south position of a point on the Earth's surface.
Geographic coordinate that specifies the east–west position of a point on the Earth's surface.
The name of the location.
A list of `References`

The reference type codes defined by DCSA. Possible values are:
- `CR` (Customer’s Reference)
- `AKG` (Vehicle Identification Number)
The value of the reference.

Reference number for agreement between shipper and carrier, which optionally includes a certain minimum quantity commitment (usually referred as “MQC”) of cargo that the shipper commits to over a fixed period, and the carrier commits to a certain rate or rate schedule.

The date of departure from the location where the cargo is handed over by the shipper, or his agent,
to the shipping line. This can refer either to the Place of Receipt or the Port of Loading.
The location where the equipment is discharged from the last mother vessel arriving at the destination country.

Details of the POD, POL or DC vessel voyages

Carrier-specific identifier of a voyage:
* the import voyage (if `typeCode` is `POD` or `DC`)
* the export voyage (if `typeCode` is `POL`)

Code representing the type of a vessel voyage.

- `DC` - Destination country
- `POD` - Port of destination
- `POL` - Port of loading

Universal identifier of a voyage:
* the import voyage (if `typeCode` is `POD` or `DC`)
* the export voyage (if `typeCode` is `POL`)
Vessel flag

The unique reference for a registered vessel, which remains unchanged throughout the entire lifetime of the vessel.
The reference is the International Maritime Organisation (IMO) number,
also sometimes known as the Lloyd's register code.
Vessel name
A unique number allocated by the shipping line to the transport document and the main number used for the tracking of the status of the shipment.

Specifies the type of the transport document
- `BOL` (Bill of Lading)
- `SWB` (Sea Waybill)
The equipments being used.
Active reefer settings applied to this equipment.
Target value for the air exchange rate which is the rate at which outdoor air replaces indoor air within a Reefer container

The unit for `airExchange` in metrics- or imperial- units per hour
- `MQH` (Cubic metre per hour)
- `FQH` (Cubic foot per hour)

**Condition:** Mandatory to provide if `airExchange` is provided
The percentage of the controlled atmosphere CO<sub>2</sub> target value
The percentage of the controlled atmosphere humidity target value
Is special container setting for handling flower bulbs active
Indicator whether cargo requires cold treatment prior to loading at origin or during transit, but prior arrival at POD
Indicator of whether cargo requires Controlled Atmosphere.
Is drain holes open on the container
If `true` the ventilation orifice is `Open` - if `false` the ventilation orifice is `closed`
The percentage of the controlled atmosphere O<sub>2</sub> target value
Target value of the temperature for the Reefer based on the cargo requirement.

The unit for temperature in Celsius or Fahrenheit

- `CEL` (Celsius)
- `FAH` (Fahrenheit)

**Condition:** Mandatory to provide if `temperatureSetpoint` is provided
A list of `Customs references`
The 2 characters for the country code using [ISO 3166-1 alpha-2](https://www.iso.org/obp/ui/#iso:pub:PUB500001:en)
The reference type code as defined in the relevant customs jurisdiction.
The container or transport equipment used.

Unique code for the different equipment size and type used to transport commodities. The code can refer to one of ISO size type (e.g. 22G1) or ISO type group (e.g. 22GP) following the [ISO 6346](https://www.iso.org/standard/83558.html) standard.

The unique identifier for the equipment, which should follow the BIC ISO Container Identification Number where possible.
According to [ISO 6346](https://www.iso.org/standard/83558.html), a container identification code consists of a 4-letter prefix and a 7-digit number (composed of a 3-letter owner code, a category identifier, a serial number, and a check-digit).

If a container does not comply with [ISO 6346](https://www.iso.org/standard/83558.html), it is suggested to follow [Recommendation #2: Containers with non-ISO identification](https://smdg.org/documents/smdg-recommendations) from SMDG.
The tare weight of the container.

The unit of measure which can be expressed in imperial or metric terms
- `KGM` (Kilograms)
- `LBR` (Pounds)
The weight of an empty container (gross container weight).

If the equipment is a Reefer Container then setting this attribute will indicate that the container should be treated as a `DRY` container.

**Condition:** Only applicable if `ISOEquipmentCode` shows a Reefer type.
Indicates whether the container is shipper owned (SOC).
A list of `References`

The reference type codes defined by DCSA. Possible values are:
- `CR` (Customer’s Reference)
- `AKG` (Vehicle Identification Number)
The value of the reference.
A list of `Seals`
Identifies a seal affixed to the container.

The source of the seal, namely who has affixed the seal.
- `CAR` (Carrier)
- `SHI` (Shipper)
- `VET` (Veterinary)
- `CUS` (Customs)

**Condition:** Seal source may be required depending on the type of commodity being shipped.

A list of the `ShippingMarks` applicable to this `UtilizedTransportEquipment`

**Condition:** The order of the items in this array **MUST** be preserved as by the provider of the API.
References of the equipments for which this arrival notice was created
The expected date of arrival of the shipment at place of delivery
The expected date of arrival of the vessel at the port of discharge
The date and time when the Arrival Notice was issued.

Free text used to indicate a certain version or type of arrival notice,
for example "Warning", "Updated", "Second", "Third" etc.

The location where the cargo is handed over by the shipping line to the consignee or its agent and where the
responsibility of the shipping line ceases
